sen.j: 明全（みょうぜん、元暦元年（1184年）- 嘉禄元年5月27日 (旧暦)（1225年7月4日））は、鎌倉時代前期の臨済宗の僧。
sen.e: Myozen (1184-July 4, 1225) was a Buddhist priest of the Rinzai sect who lived in the beginning of the Kamakura period.
Myozen (1184 - July 4, 1225) was a Buddhist priest of the Rinzai sect who lived in the beginning of the Kamakura period.
Myozen (1184 - July 11, 1225) was a Buddhist priest of the Rinzai sect who lived in the beginning of the Kamakura period.

sen.e: He also used alias name of "Butsujubo."

sen.j: 初め延暦寺の杉井房明融に師事し、その後栄西に師事して法を継いだ。
sen.e: At first Myozen learned under Sugiibo Myoyu of Enryaku-ji Temple, and then under Eisai and succeed to the teachings of Eisai.
Myozen first studied under Sugiibo Myoyu of Enryaku-ji Temple and then under Eisai; eventually, he succeeded to the teachings of Eisai.

sen.j: 1223年（貞応2年）道元・高照・廓然らを伴って中国の宋 (王朝)に渡った。
sen.e: He went to China in the Sung dynasty in 1223 along with Dogen, Kosho, Kakunen and others.

sen.j: 景福寺の妙雲、ついで栄西の師でもある太白山景徳寺の無際了派のもとで学んだ。
sen.e: He learned under Myoun of Keifuku-ji Temple and then Musai Ryoha of Keitoku-ji Temple on Mt. Taihaku who was the master of Eisai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He studied under Myoun of Keifuku-ji Temple and then Musai Ryoha of Keitoku-ji Temple on Mt. Taihaku, the latter of whom was the master of Eisai.
He studied under Myoun of Keifuku-ji Temple and then Musai Ryoha of Keitoku-ji Temple on Mt. Taihaku, the latter of whom was the master of Eisai.

sen.j: 太白山にいること3年で明全は病に倒れ了然院でなくなってしまった。
sen.e: After having been in Mt. Taihaku for three years, he got illness and died at the Ryonen-in Temple.
After having been in Mt. Taihaku for three years, he fell ill and died at Ryonen-in Temple.

sen.j: 道元は師弟関係9年の間に天台教学・黄竜派の禅・戒律などを学んだ。
sen.e: Dogen had learnt the Zen and precepts of the Oryuha lineage of the Tendai doctrine from Myozen through nine years of their relationship of master and apprentice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Dogen had studied Zen and the precepts of the Oryuha lineage of the Tendai doctrine from Myozen over the nine years of their relationship as master and apprentice.

sen.j: 道元は明全の遺骨を持ち帰り「舎利相伝記」を表し、明全の戒牒に奥書を記して永平寺に納めた。
sen.e: Dogen brought back the cremains of Myozen, wrote ''Shari sodenki" (Record of the Transmission of Sarira), and wrote an Okugaki (postscript) on the Myozen's kaicho (Certificates of Reception of Buddhist Commandments) then placed it in the Eihei-ji Temple.
